headline: The Bull Case For Charles River Laboratories (CRL) Could Change Following 2025 Losses And New Leadership Appointments
summary: Charles River Laboratories International reported fourth-quarter 2025 revenue of US$994.23 million with a net loss of US$276.56 million, alongside full-year 2025 revenue of US$4.02 billion and a net loss of US$144.34 million driven in part by sizeable goodwill and intangible asset impairments. At the same time, the company issued 2026 guidance calling for at least flat to 1.5% revenue growth and GAAP EPS of US$6.30–US$6.80, while appointing veteran healthcare finance executive Glenn G...
